title: Which Of The Following Thumbdrives Will Be Best For Booting?

forumNotes.author: TechnicGeek
forumNotes.content:
I need reliable and durable usb thumb drive with average or better speed which supports USB boot, reliable, durable, flexible, preferrably small and has keychain. Here are prices:
Patriot Xporter XT Rage - 85 ILS ‎Warranty‎: ‎Life Time‎‎ * Quad Channel technology for fast read/write performance‎ * ‎up to 27MB/s Read‎ * up to 25MB/s Write‎ * Durable design extends the life of your drive‎ * Rubber coated housing protects from drops, spills, daily abuse‎ * Retractable design protects USB connector when drive not in use‎

Corsair Voyager Mini - 95 ILS ‎Warranty‎: Life Time‎‎ * ECC 13-bit Error Correcting Codes, BCH ‎(don't know if that is good or not) * ‎Static wear leveling ‎ * USB Bootable‎:‎ Yes‎

Super Talent Express Duo - 60 ILS ‎Warranty‎: 1 Year‎ * Durable solid-state storage - 10 years data retention‎ * Single Storage Partition‎ (don't know if that is good or not)

To emphasize, Corsair Voyager Mini has static wear leveling and lifetime warranty and Super Talent has durable solid-state storage but 1 year warrany. Here are others which i question: ‎ * Transcend T3 Mini - 59 ILS (2 years warranty) * Kingston DataTraveler G3 - 58 ILS (5 years warranty) * Kingston DataTraveler HyperX2 - 90 ILS (5 years warranty) * Corsair Voyager - 95 ILS (lifetime warranty) * Patriot Xporter XT - 75 ILS (lifetime warranty) * Patriot Xporter Mini - 76 ILS (5 years warranty) * SanDisk Cruzer - 63 ILS (2 years warranty) * SanDisk Cruzer Edge - 65 ILS (2 years warranty) * SanDisk Cruzer Slice - 64 ILS (2 years warranty) * SanDisk Cruzer Blade - 57 ILS (2 years warranty)

Thanks.

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
XT Rage is v fast (fastest) - but it is quite large and you cannot get two USB stick in one above the other. Lexar Jumpdrive is reasonable and I like the design of the cover - also you can use the Bootit.exe tool to make it a Fixed or Removable disk. Verbatim Micro is very small and quite tough and quite fast. Here are some of my sticks...
``` USB MODEL SIZE (MiB) Read/Write SPEED (MiB/S) Generic USB Flash Disk USB Device 124 READ 5 Generic USB Flash Disk USB Device 124 WRITE 0.9 HP v135w USB Device 3853 READ 22.2 HP v135w USB Device 3853 WRITE 4.7 Intenso Rainbow USB Device 15423 READ 32.9 Intenso Rainbow USB Device 15423 WRITE 6.1 Kingston DataTraveler 2.0 USB Device 953 READ 14.6 Kingston DataTraveler 2.0 USB Device 953 WRITE 5.8 Lexar JD FireFly USB Device 7647 READ 21.7 Lexar JD FireFly USB Device 7647 WRITE 7.1 Lexar JD FireFly USB Device 15295 READ 22 Lexar JD FireFly USB Device 15295 WRITE 10.1 LEXAR JD SECURE USB Device 489 READ 15.9 LEXAR JD SECURE USB Device 489 WRITE 3.8 Netac OnlyDisk USB Device 956 READ 14.7 Netac OnlyDisk USB Device 956 WRITE 3.3 Patriot Memory USB Device 7643 READ 31.9 Patriot Memory USB Device 7643 WRITE 7.7 SanDisk Cruzer USB Device 3835 READ 18.6 SanDisk Cruzer USB Device 3835 WRITE 4.6 USB 2.0 USB Device 16383 READ 18.6 USB 2.0 USB Device 16383 WRITE 3.5 Verbatim STORE N GO USB Device 7639 READ 29.8 Verbatim STORE N GO USB Device 7639 WRITE 9.2 ```
